name: Phoenix Labs
moreInfo: Founded in 2014 by former Riot Games employees, Phoenix Labs developed Dauntless as their first game, which became a successful free-to-play action RPG. The studio was acquired by Garena in 2020 for $150M, but faced challenges maintaining momentum. In 2024, they announced the closure of their Vancouver studio and the end of development for Dauntless, marking a significant transition in their journey.

name: Singularity 6
moreInfo: Singularity 6 was founded by former Riot Games developers with a vision to create deeply social online games. Their debut title, Palia, is a cozy MMO that emphasizes community and collaboration over competition.

name: Theorycraft Games
moreInfo: Theorycraft Games is a studio founded by ex-Riot, Blizzard, and Bungie veterans. Their mission is to create highly replayable, competitive games that bring players together. Their first project, Supervive, is currently in development.

name: Lightforge Games
moreInfo: Lightforge Games, founded by former Riot Games employees, raised $20M to develop Project ORCS, an innovative RPG. The studio is known for its focus on narrative-driven experiences and unique gameplay mechanics. Their team brings together talent from both AAA companies and startups, focusing on creating the next generation of role-playing experiences.

name: Gardens
moreInfo: Gardens is an indie studio founded by former Riot and Journey developers. Their mission is to create beautiful, cooperative multiplayer experiences. Their first game is still unannounced.

name: The Believer Company
moreInfo: The Believer Company is focused on building games that foster camaraderie and generosity among players. Founded by ex-Riot and Sirvo Studios talent, they are working on an unannounced cooperative game.

name: Vela Games
moreInfo: Vela Games was founded by former Riot Games and EA veterans. Their first game, Evercore Heroes, is a team-based PvE competitive game.

name: Elodie Games
moreInfo: Elodie Games was an independent studio founded by veterans from Riot, BioWare, and Blizzard. Their flagship title, Seekers of Skyveil, was a free-to-play MOBA-extraction hybrid shooter that launched in early access in March 2025. Despite an innovative blend of genres and a focus on social/co-op play, the game struggled to retain players and received a mixed reception on Steam. Just 18 days after launch, Elodie Games announced the shutdown of both Seekers of Skyveil and the studio itself, citing insurmountable financial challenges. The studio had previously pivoted from a social co-op project to create Seekers of Skyveil. All in-game purchases were refunded, and the studio expressed gratitude to its community for their support.

name: Treehouse Games
moreInfo: Treehouse Games, founded by Michael Chu (former Riot Games employee) and Ryan Sullivan (co-founder of Sirvo Studios), raised $2.6M in seed funding to develop cooperative games. The studio aims to create games that 'evoke the camaraderie of a road trip, allow generosity among friends, and celebrate lasting accomplishments.' Their funding round was led by London Venture Partners. The team combines talent from both AAA companies and startups, focusing on creating social gaming experiences that go beyond traditional competitive gameplay.

name: Venn
moreInfo: Venn was a gaming-focused streaming network founded by former Riot Games employees. Despite raising $26M, the network ceased operations after failing to gain sufficient traction.

name: Pragma
moreInfo: Pragma provides backend technology for live service games. Founded by ex-Riot and PopCap engineers, Pragma has raised over $50M to support game studios with scalable infrastructure.

name: Wonderstorm
moreInfo: Wonderstorm is the studio behind the hit animated series The Dragon Prince and its upcoming game Xadia. Founded by former Riot and Naughty Dog talent, Wonderstorm blends storytelling and interactive experiences.
